I love the fact that GN drives attach to the shoulders personally, because it gives them a huge range of motion compared to if they were on a fixed point on the unit's back like most mobile suits. threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
Previous thread: >>21277686

Let's discuss the best TV series of UC Gundam.
>Should I skip ZZ?
No! ZZ is essential viewing. The First Neo Zeon War is as important as any other conflict in UC history. You miss out on essential character development(Haman & Kamille/Fa, Minerva Zabi), fantastic mecha designs, best OP/ED songs in UC, lots of great new characters (Elpeo Ple, Ple Two, Chara Soon, Roux Louka) including Judau who is one of the best protagonists in Gundam.
>But /m/ told me Moon Moon ruins the show
Absolutely not. Moon Moon is important canon wise now with Moon Gundam being a thing.
>I'm still not convinced
Haman, Kamille, Fa, Bright Noa and other favourites are still there. ZZ is still referenced in newer UC titles showing it's importance and longevity.

Rank the Cutie Honey adaptations. Here's mine:

S-tier: New Cutie Honey. Great writing, great voice acting, full of interesting villains and guest characters. 10/10 face and tits on Honey here
Good tier: Flash & OG anime. Beautiful visuals on both. OG has all those trippy backgrounds while Flash really ramps up the drama by the end.
Meh tier: Re. Not a fan of retarded Honey and bulldyke Natsuko. All style over substance and apes way too much from the 70s anime, which is typical for Annoshit. Hoping the live-action is better.
Shit tier: Universe. Utter fucking garbage. Cheap ugly animation (esp that CGI dimension where all the fights go on) and Honey is a dumb fucking cunt throughout. Only 12 eps and it alrealy feels like a slog to finish

Also been meaning to check out Tears and The Live. Thought on those?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21295727
Violence Jack 20XX is a "bold remake" of the classic Violence Jack manga, and a rather sanitized take on the cult classic at that.
It's not as dark and edgy as other Monthly Young Magazine manga like Senka, Tenkaichi, and Yomotsuhegui. The artwork can be rather uncanny valley at times, and some story arcs, the pacing is too fast, too much happens off-screen, and lacks many of the crossovers and cameo appearances of the original. We don't even get to know what happens to Ryo in this loop
Also, hyper muscle Slum King.
TL;DR VJ2K is Violence Jack written by redditfags.

Hopefully Cutie Honey a Go! Go! part 2 and/or Grendizer "Project G" are much better.

threads.com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

Does the TV version add or remove any scenes, or is it nearly identical to the movie version?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21296838
The TV version adds a couple of things from the manga that weren't adapted for the OVA series. These changes mostly concern the 5th OVA, with the differences being apparent in the last leg of Ep.10 and the beginning of Ep.11 of the TV series. Without going into spoiler territory, they are related to a certain redhead character's fate.
However, I would absolutely advice against watching the TV series over the original OVA. The TV cut massively screws up the pacing and makes some objectively terrible choices in regards to the music. Watch the OVA and then, if you're so inclined, watch the aforementioned episodes of the TV series.

Both WZC and Altron went through re-entry normally, not necessarily at a weird angle. WZC was able to shield itself with its wings while Altron just endured the heat, so if anything, atmospheric entry shouldn't have harmed the WZC at all since Altron was completely fine.

>>21294791
It's probably not even the atmospheric entry that damaged the Wing Gundam, since it had the shuttle camouflage armor that absorbed the heat. It did plunge into the ocean from a far greater height than the Wing Zero did since it was falling the entire time it was fighting Zechs' Leo and the two Aries, though.

The Wing looked undamaged at a glance, but later after Howard helps Heero pull it up from the bottom of the ocean and both Heero and Duo start repairs on their Gundams, it turns out that the Wing Gundam needed some spare parts. At that point in the show, the Wing Gundam had some minor internal damage from being hit by Zechs' dobergun and an unknown amount of damage from hitting the ocean from episode 1, as well as some unknowable amount of damage from being hit by the triple torpedoes from episode 2.

There was the whole scene in episode 4 where Duo was giving Heero shit about how it's impossible for Heero to take on the next mission without spare parts to fix the Wing Gundam and Heero was saying it'd be fine. A couple of hours later Heero is taking off from the ship for his mission and Duo was praising him as a mechanic, but then it turns out that Heero disassembled Deathscythe to get the spare parts he needed to make the Wing Gundam workable again.

>>21261142

I find this to be a weird take because if the antagonist is supposed to be the one you're rooting for then...why aren't they the protagonist in the first place? A protagonist just being the character a story follows, and not inherently tied to the character's morality, personality, goals etc. at all. A protagonist does not need to be a "meek good guy", and I wouldn't describe any of the previous Gundam protagonists beyond perhaps Al as that anyway. I definitely wouldn't describe Amuro, Kamille or Judau as "meek" for one, even if they're "good guys".

If the audience is supposed to be rooting for the highly motivated antagonist and not the poorly motivated protagonist though, then the antagonist is the more interesting character and the story should be following him because he's the more interesting character who is doing more interesting things. If you want a reason why more stories don't do things like that then it's probably because more stories follow the interesting character, whether they're a good guy or not, and not the less interesting one. The antagonist is often cooler in a lot of stories, but usually isn't notably more interesting; though then again, I'd say the same is broadly true of Gato. I say broadly, because while I can certainly see why someone would think he's cooler, I definitely don't think he's interesting. I don't think any of 0083's cast are interesting though. Gato's coolness is very superficial too, beyond even that of someone like Char.

>>21291025
The Barbatos Lupus and Lupus Rex both have extra modes on top of max power, like the Lupus's shoulder igniting on fire and the Rex having full on lightning eyes and reactor steam. Lupus Rex in particular achieves a state where Mika's basically a corpse and it's still working. Not to mention Mika uses a completely inhuman appendage like it's a part of his body. The AV system has a flaw in which pilots aren't used to extra parts being part of their body, something McGillis points out and targets during his first sortie against Mika in space by targeting his backpack.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21290964

> There's also lore about how during the Calamity War, Gundam pilots mostly acted as bait. They'd draw the mobile armors to more isolated locations and keep them there while they were shot with danslief from a safe distance (like space. Just look at Hashmal's excavation).

This makes no sense for basically the same reason that the use of dainsleifs to take out the Barbatos and Gusion in the finale makes no sense, because dainsliefs and hypersonic kinetic impactors like them don't travel that fast when talking about launching them from fucking orbit. If the units were in low orbit then they could be as high up as 2,000km (assuming terraformed Mars' gravity is anything like Earths), but even if they were just 100km above sea level; a hypersonic impactor usually only travels about mach 5. Which would take maybe 10 seconds to cover that distance. Which is almost certainly far lower than the actual height the Graze's were shooting at, since none of them appeared to be using thrust to adjust for height and/or combat gravity.

So the Barbatos, Gusion and/or any theoretical mobile armors that the Gundams fought during the Calamity War would have had to stand stock still for 10 seconds plus for any kinetic impactor shot from orbit to hit them, not moving by more than a couple of meters in any cardinal direction, because the shot would whiff if the target moved by more than it's own body dimension. Which is...unlikely unless you are literally sitting on top of it. At which point you'll get pinned down too. Barbatos and Gusion standing stock still for that long, if not for several minutes if the Graze's were at any reasonable height is just so silly/lazy that I can't give it any credit as a tactic personally. Not when the troops attacking them did nothing to actually lock them down, beyond moving out of range.

threads.com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer
